dsls.markdown:
##Plan Your Star Quilt

It's time to plan your star quilt.

>First you will select four different colors and fill in your Star Quilt. Then you'll do some more activities with patterns. **Ready to get started?** Use this resource.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code the artist to draw a rhombus stamp with your choice of color.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
example

**Use a rhombus stamp** - Drag the draw shape block and snap it under the when run block. - Use the drop down menu to select a rhombus color. - Click run to test your code and then click finish to move on to the next level.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code the artist to place another rhombus shape to the right of the existing one, making sure to use the correct angle measurement.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Place another rhombus shape next to the existing one.**

example

- Use the turn right by block to get in the correct position for the next rhombus - Use the drop down menu to select the correct angle measurement - Then, use a draw shape block to create your next rhombus

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code the artist to repeat the pattern to create a 6-point star.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Repeat this pattern to create a 6 point star.**

example

- Use the turn right by block to get in the correct position for the next rhombus - Use the drop down menu to select the correct angle measurement - Then, use a draw shape block to create your next rhombus - Repeat until you have a 6-point star

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Experiment with the turn block in your code to create a 4-point star.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Experiment with the turn block in your code to create a 4 point star.**

example

- Modify the angle of the turn block to find the correct angle for a four point star. - How many times should your loop repeat?

authored_hints.hint1:
This is the chunk of code that repeats: 
[blockly block][0]
authored_hints.hint2:
Put the chunk of code into a loop block: 

[blockly block][0]
authored_hints.hint3:
How many times does the pattern repeat? 
4 times. 

Put the number 4 in the number field of the loop block. 

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Experiment with the angle in the turn block in your code to create a 12-point star.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Can you make a 12 point star?**

example

- Modify the angle of the turn block to find the correct angle for a 12 point star. - How many times should your loop repeat?

authored_hints.hint1:
Put the number `12` in the number field of the loop block. 
Change the `turn right` block to 30 degrees.

[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Experiment with colors, angles, and loops to draw your own awesome star shape!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
_Draw an awesome star shape! Make it your own by experimenting with colors, angles and looping._

example

example

example

example

example

callouts.New Artist Project_callout2: Hit "Run" to save and run your program

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: First, let's practice using comments in our code.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions: Keep your code organized by always using the comment block first. - Drag a the comment block and snap it under when run - Drag the set length to 35 block and snap it under your comment - Click Finish Note: Nothing will happen yet and that's ok! We're getting our code organized.

authored_hints.hint1:
Your code should look like this: 
[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code Row 1 to add the first rhombus shape. There will be a total of 5 Rows to make 1-point of a larger 8-point star.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Make the first row of one point of your star.** There will be 5 rows in all to complete one point of your 8-point star.

example

- Drag a new comment block to start Row 1 - Drag a draw shape block and snap it under your comment block

authored_hints.hing1:
Your code should look like this: 
[blockly block][0]

callouts.New Artist Project_callout2: Hit "Run" to save and run your program
callouts.sign_in_to_save_project: Want to access your project later? Sign in to save this project to your account!

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code Row 2 to have your artist draw two more rhombus shapes above Row 1.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Let’s move on to Row 2**

example

- Add a new comment block for "Row 2" - The Artist needs to jump diagonalRight - Add a new draw shape block - Then use the bumpLeft block to nudge the Artist over - Add another draw shape block

authored_hints.finished code: Your finished code should look like this [blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code Row 3 to add three more rhombus shapes above Row 2.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Time to make Row 3**

example

- Start with a "Row 3" comment block - Have the Artist jump diagonalLeft - Then, add a new draw shape block - Have the Artist bumpRight - Make another rhombus - Then, bumpRight again - Make your last rhombus of this row

authored_hints.hint1:
Your code should look like this: 
[blockly block][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code Row 4 to add two rhombus shapes above Row 3.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**We're getting close! Draw the next row.**

example

- Start with a "Row 4" comment block - Have the Artist jump diagonalLeft - Add a new draw shape block - Nudge the Artist over with bumpLeft - Add another draw shape block

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code the final Row 5 to the last rhombus shape above Row 4.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Finally time for Row 5!**

example

- Start with a "Row 5" comment block - Make the Artist jump diagonalRight - Draw your final rhombus shape - Last, jump to middle center to get the Artist back in starting position

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Code the 8-point Star Quilt using the repeat block with the chunk of code that needs to be repeated!
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions: **Let's make an 8-point Star Quilt!** - Use the turn right block and set it to 45 degrees to get the artist ready for the next point of the star. - Which chunk of code needs to be repeated to complete the star quilt? - Use the repeat block to complete your star quilt. (How many times should this pattern repeat?)

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.short_instructions: Draw something awesome! Your code is saved as a project that you can return to at any time.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-starquilts.long_instructions:
**Free Play: Now it’s your turn to customize your star quilt.** 

You could:

-   Change the color pattern of your quilt
-   Make more or less points using different rhombuses with different angles
